quiz.question: How many portions of fruit and veg do you need a day?
The word 'muscle' comes from what latin word?
How much moderate aerobic activity should you try to get per week?
Why is protein important in a diet?
Which of these is a way for children to get exercise?

information-pages.title: Why you should have a healthy lifestyle

sections.text: Having a healthy lifestyle can prevent mental health issues such as depression.
Having a healthy lifestyle can lower the risk of getting certain health conditions, such as diabetes, cancer and arthritis.
You should aim to eat at least five 80 gram portions of fruit and vegetables a day.
Protein is important for your muscles. You should eat at least 0.75g per kg of your body weight per day.
You should aim to get at least 150 minutes of moderate aerobic activity a week or 75 minutes of vigorous aerobic activity a week.
You should do strength training for all major muscle groups at least twice a week.

Some fun ways for children to get exercise include:
- Dancing
- Playing tig
- Going on walks
- Going to the park

sections.heading-title: How to look after your mental health
sections.text:
Some methods you can use to look after your mental health include:
- Being in the present
- Getting good sleep
- Spending time with others
- Spending time doing hobbies you enjoy

sections.heading-title: What happens if you don't have good mental health?
sections.text: Poor mental health can affect your life in lots of unwanted ways. These include feeling sad or anxious or having trouble sleeping.
Regularly drinking too much alcohol can lead to cancer, strokes, heart disease, liver disease, brain damage and damage to the nervous system.

In Scotland, you must be 18 to buy alcohol. It is illegal to give alcohol to a child under the age of five, although other people under 18 may drink alcohol at home. It is not recommended for anyone below 18 to drink alcohol.

- Milk is good for your bones and teeth
- Bananas are technically a berry
- Chewing on lean meat is good for your jaw muscles
- Strawberries are the only fruit with seeds on the outside
- Apples, pears, and peaches are all in the rose family

- The word 'muscle' comes from the Latin for 'little mouse' (musculus)
- Your left lung is 10% smaller than your right lung to leave room for your heart
- Your blood makes up 8% of your body weight
- Students who exercise tend to have better grades than those who don't

- Laughing 100 times is equivalent to 15 minutes of exercise on a stationary bike
- You burn more calories sleeping than you do watching television
- Right-handed people live on average nine years longer than left-handed people
- During your lifetime, you eat about 30,000kg of food, which is the weight of around six African elephants.
